pageContext.description:
An incomplete possible Bronze Age copper alloy annular or penannular bracelet. The object is now folded in two and the band has corroded. It is possible that it has broken but in its current condition it is also possible it was a penannular design. It has a D shape section band and there is no visible decoration to the surface, the copper alloy has a dark olive green patination. When complete the bracelet would have been quite small in diameter. The band is a relatively regular width and thickness along its length, save for a small area where corrosion has narrowed the band considerably. A Bronze Age date is possible based on its context, close to other finds of prehistoric date.



Length: 75.07mm
Width: 4.92mm
Thickness: 2.43mm
Weight: 12.35g
